history.content: The course focuses on algorithms, which happen to have biological motivations. But the focus is on the former. (You can probably get through the course without paying attention to any of the bio parts.)

children.subject:
I took the course, yes.

I don't recall hearing anything in particular about it.

I'm not good at assessing workload/difficulty, but it seemed typical for a CS course? It requires similar types of thinking as 170/other algorithm-focused courses do, with probably lower workloads.

I definitely have no idea about how useful it is for purposes most people care about; it's supposed to be useful in programming contests (which is why I took the course), but I haven't really done any of those in the last few years.

I don't think it was hard to get into, at least when I took the course last semester.

Thank you!

1. Do you have access to any discussion worksheets or homeworks from the class? Even better, what's the link to the class website? I wanted to see the problems to gauge how difficult and interesting the problems are.

2. Also, did it help you with programming competitions? Around half the class seems to be string matching:

https://niryosef.wordpress.com/teaching/cs176/

so I was doubting if covers enough material.

Thank you!

(Also I thought you said you graduated last year, Steven. Am I wrong?)

The course website was just on Piazza. You can check with the instructor to see if he'll share course resources.

Like I said, I haven't done programming contests recently. But the earlier string algorithms (which was only about a third to a half of the course) are precisely what the part that are relevant; the rest is probably less relevant to this interest.

I graduated in December, which was last year. I took this class in the fall, which was last semester.

Steven, thank you for your response. Have you taken the course? What have you heard about it? Can you comment on its workload, usefulness of its material, difficulty, or how tough it is to get into the course? Thanks.

history.content:
I am considering taking cs 176 next semester. However, I wanted to get your reviews on the course. I am taking cs 170 right now and would like to build on my algorithms knowledge.

While I will take cs 270 in spring 2018, I want to take another algorithms course in the fall. I've looked at the material, and honestly I can't tell much about the course: Does it emphasize algorithms, or the computational biology concepts? I definitely will take it if it emphasizes the former (algorithms).

Thank you!
history.subject: CS 176 Reviews?
